newsitem.title: UK: Shell Q1 profit flat, cautious on oil price.
newsitem.headline: Shell Q1 profit flat, cautious on oil price.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell Group reported flat first-quarter earnings on Thursday and warned that crude oil prices may show further weakness after they started to fall earlier this year.
Earnings excluding special items rose one percent to 1.545 billion pounds ($2.5 billion) from 1.535 billion a year ago.
Shell said profits were held back by the pound's strength, adding that earnings would have risen by seven percent if measured in dollars.
Apart from being cautious on oil prices, the Anglo-Dutch oil giant also said it expected refining margins to remain under pressure.
First quarter earnings in the refining sector were similar to a year ago as lower profits in the United States were offset by an improved performance elsewhere in the world.
Exploration and production earnings rose to their second highest quarterly level ever, but the impact of higher oil prices compared with a year ago was partly offset by lower gas volumes.
In chemicals, earnings rose as cost reductions outweight lower margins. ($ = 0.616 British Pounds)
